channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-2207] [6.2][047] log:tail not working in fabric
item.description:
After creating a Fabric, invocation of log:tail halts in karaf shell.

Logs show:

2014-11-19 10:11:01,196 | ERROR | pool-48-thread-1 | NIOServerCnxnFactory             | 90 - io.fabric8.fabric-zookeeper - 1.2.0.redhat-047 | Thread Thread[pool-48-thread-1,5,main] died
 
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/ops4j/pax/logging/service/internal/PaxLevelImpl
 
	at org.ops4j.pax.logging.service.internal.PaxLoggingEventImpl.getLevel(PaxLoggingEventImpl.java:92)[4:org.ops4j.pax.logging.pax-logging-service:1.8.1]
 
	at org.apache.karaf.shell.log.DisplayLog.getColor(DisplayLog.java:171)
 
	at org.apache.karaf.shell.log.DisplayLog.display(DisplayLog.java:143)
 
	at org.apache.karaf.shell.log.LogTail$PrintEventThread.run(LogTail.java:97)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)[:1.7.0_51]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)[:1.7.0_51]
 
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)[:1.7.0_51]
 
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Unable to load class 'org.ops4j.pax.logging.service.internal.PaxLevelImpl' because the bundle wiring for org.ops4j.pax.logging.pax-logging-service is no longer valid.
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(BundleWiringImpl.java:1521)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.access$400(BundleWiringImpl.java:77)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoader.loadClass(BundleWiringImpl.java:1993)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:358)[:1.7.0_51]
 
	... 7 more
 
2014-11-19 10:12:06,024 | ERROR | pool-49-thread-1 | NIOServerCnxnFactory             | 90 - io.fabric8.fabric-zookeeper - 1.2.0.redhat-047 | Thread Thread[pool-49-thread-1,5,main] died
 
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/ops4j/pax/logging/service/internal/PaxLevelImpl
 
	at org.ops4j.pax.logging.service.internal.PaxLoggingEventImpl.getLevel(PaxLoggingEventImpl.java:92)[4:org.ops4j.pax.logging.pax-logging-service:1.8.1]
 
	at org.apache.karaf.shell.log.DisplayLog.getColor(DisplayLog.java:171)
 
	at org.apache.karaf.shell.log.DisplayLog.display(DisplayLog.java:143)
 
	at org.apache.karaf.shell.log.LogTail$PrintEventThread.run(LogTail.java:97)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)[:1.7.0_51]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)[:1.7.0_51]
 
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)[:1.7.0_51]


Fabric8:karaf@root> find-class PaxLevelImpl

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Reported independently upstream by Guillaume Nodet :

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KARAF-3350

The workaround to get back tail:log functionality is to restart io.fabric8.fabric-zookeeper but an automated solution still needs to be found

restart io.fabric8.fabric-zookeeper

It's a quite disruptive operation, but at the end of the restart process, log:tail is back

A possible bad solution, could be to add a dependency directly on Pax Logging bundle, since it's not exporting anything else:

In fabric-zookeeper pom.xml

 
            <plugin>
 
                <groupId>org.apache.felix</groupId>
 
                <artifactId>maven-bundle-plugin</artifactId>
 
                <configuration>
 
                    <instructions>
 
                        <Gravia-Enabled>true</Gravia-Enabled>
 
                        <Require-Bundle>org.ops4j.pax.logging.pax-logging-service</Require-Bundle>
 
                    </instructions>
 
                </configuration>
 
            </plugin>
Calling log:clear is a better work around.
Hi Guillaume Nodet , I have just tried it on 047 but that hasn't worked.
